Line 25: Line 25:
OpenBitTorrent has been suspected of being a part of or a side project of [[The Pirate Bay]], because it was observed early on that both sites used the same [[BitTorrent tracker|tracker]]s.<ref>[http://torrentfreak.com/openbittorrent-tracker-muscles-in-on-the-old-pirate-bay-090705/#comment-576934 Comment concerning OBT on torrentfreak.com from 05.07.2009]</ref> The OpenBitTorrent project has countered by stating that the sites merely shared a tracker cluster operated by DCP Networks and [[Fredrik Neij]] during a startup period (February through August 2009).
OpenBitTorrent has been suspected of being a part of or a side project of [[The Pirate Bay]], because it was observed early on that both sites used the same [[BitTorrent tracker|tracker]]s.<ref>[http://torrentfreak.com/openbittorrent-tracker-muscles-in-on-the-old-pirate-bay-090705/#comment-576934 Comment concerning OBT on torrentfreak.com from 05.07.2009]</ref> The OpenBitTorrent project has countered by stating that the sites merely shared a tracker cluster operated by DCP Networks and [[Fredrik Neij]] during a startup period (February through August 2009).
â
On May 22, 2010, the OpenBitTorrent tracker was shut down, although the site remains.<ref name="down">[http://torrentfreak.com/hollywood-lands-triple-strike-on-pirate-bay-openbittorrent-100522/ Hollywood Lands Triple Strike On Pirate Bay, OpenBitTorrent]</ref> This was a result of a case against The Pirate Bay by many major Hollywood studios.
+
On May 22, 2010, the OpenBitTorrent tracker was shut down, although the site remains.<ref name="down">[http://torrentfreak.com/hollywood-lands-triple-strike-on-pirate-bay-openbittorrent-100522/ Hollywood Lands Triple Strike On Pirate Bay, OpenBitTorrent]</ref> This was a result of a case against The Pirate Bay by many major Hollywood studios. Later the tracker came back online.
